speaker: Tower Ascent
lines: Steps count themselves; you count something else to stay even.
Windows blink out over rooftops that pretend they weren't watching.
A landing hosts a painting of a door that has opened for better people.
A chain rattles against a hook that forgot its job.
Breath finds a rhythm where each exhale is a small surrender and each inhale a truce.
Lightning thinks better of it and chooses the bell instead.
Your hand trails the wall; dust writes a map on your fingertips.
At the top, a doorway waits with exactly enough room for your courage.
Something on the other side adjusts its crown.

choices.text: Go back while the steps still remember you kindly.
Pause and catch the breath the tower offers (mana).
